message: I've always wanted to develop a "social" site, and Revview is my first attempt at doing it. Let me know what you guys think!

Revview (http://revview.in) is a social networking service that lets you post movie reviews in a simple way. You can also plan to see movies with your friends and followers. It's a Twitter+Flixster kind of thing. Revview is heavily integrated with Twitter and Rottentomatoes API.

I love that product! Is what I'm looking for 2 years! But here what I really want from that produt:
a) share on twitter should be optional (I want to add a lot of films and it can become noisy)
b) I want the "Watched" and the "Planned" divided lists (like in Anobii, with my Shelf and my Whislist)
c) I want to plan to see a lot of film in the future (specially when they'll become available in dvd), but I don't know when and where. So, when and where should be optional
d) in the future a simple iphone app will be great ;)

Pretty cool site actually, very simple to use / clean interface. I agree about being about having two lists for movies you plan to watch and reviews.

I would change the way the "Plan to Watch" thing works. The date selection is good, but the time isn't super intuitive if you don't know your military time. Also, if I enter an address it should show a map of where I plan to see it or something?
